##Open-source projects


I think that a critical point to make linux more popular is to made it simple and user friendly.
Well, when I installed linux for the first time, I encounterd a very big problem: the hybrid graphics support. 

In fact the battery life of my laptop was very poor, about 40 minutes, and the temperature was always very high. This made me using almost all the time windows, where I have an optimal power management.
I've tried lot of ways to resolve this problem, and finally i found it in acpi_call. With this kernel module I could deactivate the discrete gpu of my laptop, so battery life and temperature began to be similiar to windows. But the installation and usage of this kernel module is not very user friendly for a beginner, so i decided to made it more simple.

I've created for it a graphic interface and some automatization scripts, you can find these projects here:
 * [acpi_call_GUI : ubuntu and debian based distros version](https://github.com/marcoDallas/acpi_call_GUI)
 * [acpi_call_GUI_Fedora : fedora version](https://github.com/marcoDallas/acpi_call_GUI_Fedora)


***
